v.v: Surely there is a mine for silver,
Iron is taken out of the earth;
A man sets an end to darkness
He breaks open a shaft away from where people live,
As for the earth, out of which comes bread,
Its stones are the place where sapphires are found,
No bird of prey knows the path to it,
The proud animals have not walked such a path,
A man lays his hand on the flinty rock;
He cuts out channels among the rocks;
He ties up the streams so they do not run;

v: a place where they refine gold.
copper is smelted out of the stone.
and searches out, to the farthest limit,
the stones in obscurity and thick darkness.
places that are forgotten by anyone’s foot.
He hangs far away from people; he swings to and fro.
it is turned up below as if by fire.
and its dust contains gold.
nor has the falcon’s eye seen it.
nor has the fierce lion passed there.
he overturns mountains by their roots.
his eye sees every valuable thing there.
what is hidden there he brings out to the light.

v.v: Where will wisdom be found?
Man does not know its price;
The deep waters under the earth say, ‘It is not in me’;
It cannot be gotten for gold;
It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir,
Gold and crystal cannot equal it in worth;
No mention is worth making of coral or jasper;
The topaz of Cush does not equal it;
From where, then, comes wisdom?
Wisdom is hidden from the eyes of all living things
Destruction and Death say,

v: Where is the place of understanding?
neither is it found in the land of the living.
the sea says, ‘It is not with me.’
neither can silver be weighed as its price.
with precious onyx or sapphire.
neither can it be exchanged for jewels of fine gold.
indeed, the price of wisdom is more than rubies.
neither can it be valued in terms of pure gold.
Where is the place of understanding?
and is kept hidden from the birds of the heavens.
‘We have heard just a rumor about it with our ears.’

v.v: God understands the way to it;
For he looks to the very ends of the earth
He made the force of the wind
He made a decree for the rain
Then he saw wisdom and announced it;
To people he said,

v: he knows its place.
and sees under all the heavens.
and parceled out the waters by measure.
and a path for the thunder.
he established it, indeed, and he examined it.
‘See, the fear of the Lord—that is wisdom;
to depart from evil is understanding.’”
